examples: Over the years, their industry and business sense made them wealthy.

definitions.definition: Businesses of the same type, considered as a whole. Trade .
examples: The software and tourism industries continue to grow, while the steel industry remains troubled.
The steel industry has long used blast furnaces to smelt iron.

definitions.definition: Businesses that produce goods as opposed to services .
The sector of the economy consisting of large-scale enterprises.
examples: There used to be a lot of industry around here, but now the economy depends on tourism.

definitions.definition: A typological classification of stone tools , associated with a technocomplex .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The tendency to work persistently.
secondary_definitions: ( countable , business , economics ) Businesses of the same type, considered as a whole. Trade .
( uncountable , economics ) Businesses that produce goods as opposed to services .
( in the singular , economics ) The sector of the economy consisting of large-scale enterprises.
( Europe software patent law ) Automated production of material goods.
( archaeology ) A typological classification of stone tools , associated with a technocomplex .
